context_0.vignette: Heinz's wife has recently fallen ill and needs an expensive medication that is not covered by her medical insurance. They do not have the money needed to purchase the expensive prescription medication, but they know that it is vital for her to have it if she is going to recover.

generation: seek for help from friends, relatives, or community-based organizations that could lend him the money to purchase the medication
seek financial assistance from charities, non-profit organizations, or government programs that help individuals in need of expensive medical treatments
take out a loan or borrow money from friends or family members to pay for the medication
try finding help through a prescription assistance program
try and raise funds in various ways to afford the medication
look for assistance programs or charities that offer help with medication costs
start a crowdfunding campaign on platforms like GoFundMe to help raise the money required
seek financial assistance from family, friends, or social communities
start a crowdfunding campaign on platforms like GoFundMe to raise money for her medication

reach out to charities and non-profit organizations that help with medical expenses, set up a crowdfunding campaign to raise the funds necessary, talk to the doctor about possible alternatives, or consult with the pharmacist about a generic or cheaper version of the same medication

context_1.vignette: Josh is on the way to the airport to catch a flight for a hunting safari in Africa. He leaves with plenty of time to make it there, but his car breaks down on the highway. Now Josh is sitting in his car near a busy intersection, and knows he needs to get to airport soon if he is going to catch his flight.

call a taxi, an Uber, or a friend to quickly come pick him up and take him to the airport
call a taxi, an Uber or other rideshare service to come and pick him up
call for a taxi, ride-sharing service or emergency roadside assistance to either fix his car quickly or take him to the airport

context_4.vignette: Mary is about to go to her final class of the day when she remebers that there is a homework assignment that is due. Mary's mom accidentally took her homework assignment out of her backpack when she was making room for her lunch. Now Mary has nothing to turn in for credit.
context_4.prompt: One thing that Mary could do is to
generation: explain the situation to her teacher and ask if she could turn it in the next day or email a picture or scanned copy of the assignment
call or text her mom to bring the assignment to school if possible
contact her teacher and explain the situation honestly, asking for an extension
contact her teacher, explain what happened, and ask if she could either submit it digitally or hand in it physically the next day
email her teacher explaining the situation, and ask for an extension of time to submit her homework
contact her teacher, explain the situation, and request for some extension
explain the situation to her teacher, showing sincerity and remorse, and ask for an extension or the opportunity to submit it later
quickly explain the situation to her teacher and politely ask for an extension to submit her homework
explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension to submit her homework
email her teacher explaining the situation and ask if she could submit the assignment immediately the following day

context_5.vignette: Brad and some friends are hiking through the mountains in the Canadian wilderness. A couple of days into their hike, Brad realizes that they are lost. He knows that a rescue crew could arrive before long, but it is extremely cold and they don't have much food or water left.
context_5.prompt: One thing that Brad could do is to
generation: set up a signal such as a smoke signal or SOS sign in a clearing or on a hill, where it can be easily spotted from the air
start by rationing out the remaining food and water among his friends in order to maximize the resources
prioritize their immediate needs, such as shelter, warmth, water, and food
start a fire to keep warm and send a distress signal
begin rationing their remaining food and water to extend its use
start building an emergency shelter to store their remaining supplies, retain body heat and protect them from harsh weather conditions
create a signal for help
start a fire to keep everyone warm and try to send a smoke signal
start building a temporary shelter using leaves, branches, or anything else available to provide protection from the elements
build a fire for warmth, try to ration their remaining food and water, and find a clear, open space where they could be more visible from the sky for a rescue team
